item.title: Google Play Games is about to show people what you play

review.headline_rewrite: Google Play Games is about to show people what you play
bullets: The changes include a suite of new capabilities for “showcasing and tracking your game progress and stats, new ways to build your gaming community, and allowing you to tailor your profile to your liking,” according to Google’s help page.
Google is also emailing Google Play users directly to notify them about the changes.
The unified update aims to help users who make their profile information public to connect with other players and track their gaming milestones.
It’s unclear what this will specifically entail, but it sounds similar to how player information, gaming history, and achievements are currently displayed on Valve’s Steam service.

item.title: Technology Aug 30, 2025 Meta AI head Alexandr Wang's memo to employees on massive AI restructure makes one thing clear: Everyone will ... Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.

review.headline_rewrite: Technology Aug 30, 2025 Meta AI head Alexandr Wang's memo to employees on massive AI restructure makes one thing clear: Everyone will ... Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.
bullets: In a new and dramatic move, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is making the most aggressive move in his AI arm race.
As reported by Business Insider the company outlined the move in an internal memo from the newly appointed chief of AI Alexandr Wang.

The internal email, sent by Alexandr Wang, the 28-year-old head of Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL), outlines a dramatic restructuring aimed at accelerating Metaâs pursuit of âpersonal superintelligenceââAI that can outperform humans across intellectual domains.
According to a report by Business Insider, the reorganization splits the companyâs AI efforts into four specialized teamsâTBD Lab, FAIR, Products & Applied Research, and MSL Infra.
However, another important update shared in the memo revealed that nearly all the senior leaders in Metaâs AI ecosystem will now directly report to Wang.
This list also includes high-profile hires like former GitHub CEO Nat Friedman, who will lead product integration, and engineering veteran Aparna Ramani, who will oversee infrastructure.

Grammarly launches new AI agents to assist students and professionals with writing tasks
Grammarly has introduced eight new AI agents within its AI writing surface, 'docs,' designed to aid students and professionals with diverse writing tasks.
These agents offer functionalities like citation finding, plagiarism checking, and AI detection, alongside features predicting reader reactions and providing rubric-based feedback.
This launch signifies Grammarly's move towards agent-based AI to enhance writing across various platforms.
